resources.string: "Welcome to surespot! Data sent using this app is end-to-end encrypted with symmetric-key encryption (256 bit AES) using keys created with 521 bit ECDH shared secret derivation."
No friends...yet. Invite surespot users by entering their username and touching "invite".\nUse the "share surespot" menu option to invite future surespot users.
Touch "home" to go to the home tab.
Hold "home" to close the chat tab.
Hold on a message for message options.
Hold on a friend for friend options.
Zoom images by touching the image.
could not create new key pairs
key pairs created and successfully uploaded to the server

It is with deep shame that we have to confess that an unexpected error has occurred.\n\nPlease help us to fix the issue by clicking OK to send an error report containing no personally identifying information.
You can add your comments about the problem below if you like:
"I'd like to chat with you privately via surespot. Click this link to install the android app and invite me as a friend: "

"Because surespot uses encryption keys that are never uploaded to our servers, if you lose your phone, or uninstall then re-install the app, or wipe the app's data, you will not be able to login unless you have backed up your identity."

"Surespot has a cloud based identity backup mechanism that can be enabled from the settings menu. You can also choose to leave this disabled and backup your keys manually to local storage from the settings menu."

"By checking below you are enabling surespot to backup your identity via Google's Android Data Backup Service. In order for this to work your phone must have 'backup my data' and 'automatic restore' enabled. There are some caveats around this. While surespot can tell Google 'hey we need a backup done', as to when that backup actually occurs is anyone's guess. For this reason surespot will notify you when the backup actually occurs. Until then your identities are not backed up so try not to lose your phone! We recommend backing up manually."

"By enabling this you will be storing a copy of your private keys on a cloud server which means that anyone that gains access to them (through hacking or other means) can perform attacks against them (eg. brute force) to try to gain access to your account. Your keys will be encrypted with 256 bit AES with a key derived from your password. While surespot uses a PBKDF to slow down a brute force attack, be aware that the strength of your password in this backup scenario ultimately determines the level of security."

"This will export a copy of the selected identity encrypted with 256 bit AES with a key derived from your password through a PBKDF (Password Based Key Derivation Function) to the location below. This file should then be copied from your device (via USB cable for maximum security) to a secure backup location on a PC or elsewhere so that it can be restored in the case of app uninstall, a lost or stolen device, or if the identity data was somehow removed from the device."

"no ads

pay what you like

help support the EFF"

Surespot has a 1000 message history. Once you reach 1000 messages your oldest message will be deleted so you will only ever have 1000 (encrypted) messages stored on the server. Of course you can delete any and all of your messages at any time.
"please visit the surespot website at https://www.surespot.me for more information, including the terms of service and privacy policy"
"surespot is 100% open source and welcomes your participation - view the source code on github at https://github.com/surespot"
"for a more technical overview of how surespot works please click here"
"for questions or support please support@2fours.com
"Click the contacts button to select numbers from your phone contacts, and/or enter them manually. (Please [click here] if contacts fail to populate in your sms app)."
